Articles.Content:
Nope. But we used to own one in my childhood. In the old days..... *sighs*

The user below me played in a sandbox as a child aswell.

My dad drove 50 miles each way to a friend's property to get a couple truckloads of sand (big deal back then as he was always working and we never had much money). The best part was building a dam and seeing how full I could make it with the hose before it burst. The worst part was a couple years after we got cats, and I realized what that funny smell in the sandbox was.

Can't wait to make one for my son, assuming we get a dog.

TUBM has broken in to / opened someone else's locked car to retrieve a set of keys.

Uhh... no? What do you mean anyway?

TUBM is not addicted to anything (except KSP)

ARK:SE For life! (Alright, From The Depths as well). Actually, atm I'm not addicted to either, so that's a no for the next few days.

TUBM has played either ARK: Survival Evolved or From The Depths.

Nope. Neither.

The user below me has played Diablo 3 and liked it.

Uhh... no? What do you mean anyway?

Example: You work at a store and a customer locks their keys in the car... Or yesterday at work, a customer needed to catch a plane in 1 hour but locked her keys and luggage in her vehicle. No time for a locksmith.

All legal, of course.

----------------

Never played 3 but I didn't like 2... Probably was just playing with the wrong crowd on LAN.

TUBM is uses linux at work.

Nope - I used Ubuntu on my Netbook for the university for some time though.

The user below me never used Linux.

True.

TUBM also doesnt understand how can you get keys stuck in a car. (i guess self-locking door? if yes, who d'hell made this thing)

True.

TUBM is afraid of heights.

Edit - Ninja'd:

Well - I wouldn't walk around on an unfinished skyscraper. But I dont have a problem with stepping on the top of a ladder.

I have a Volkswagen that will self-relock after a minute or so if the car was locked, you unlocked it with the remote and just open the trunk.

Not sure why this is - but I'm super concious not to lay my keys into the trunk when geting something out of it. Not that there would be any reason to do so....

So....no, I understand how this could happen.

The user below me never drove a Volkswagen.

Edited August 16, 2015 by Xeldrak

Nope. Only just began driving, and that is in a Chevy.

TUBM is listening to music as he/she replies to this.

Nope. I am listening to the radio - but just news right now.

The user below me likes to cook.

Yeeeah chemists like to cook heheee...

baked beans obviously

The person below me has a hippopotomonstrosesquipedaliophobia ( phobia of long words)

Affirmative- AHHHHHHHHHH

TUBM thinks I lied.

Yes.

This statement is false.

TUBM, like me, knows how to solve this paradox.

Hmm.... True. I'll go with true.

The user below me likes potatoes.

Potato chips?

The user below me is a modder

I made a couple tiny mods to Oblivion for personal use (stock arrows flew like they were made of cardboard, wanted them faster). Not KSP though -- not yet, anyways.

TUBM has never played Morrowind.

True.

The user below me has never played a Pen&Paper RPG.

False. D&D, Traveller, Marvel, Paranoia, Twilight 2000, probably some others I'm forgetting.

The user below me likes pen&paper RPGs, too.

True. I think I still have character sheets older than some forum members... Btw, if you like pen & paper try Morrowind. It's not at all like Oblivion or Skyrim.

TUBM thinks SLS is too expensive for what it does.

Edit: Ninja'd, but only changing one word makes my reply still work (False becomes True)...

Edited August 17, 2015 by ComradeWolfe
Ninja'd. Edit 2: Typo.

HmmmÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.

Selective Laser Sintering: this sounds like a good deal to me.

Structured Light Sensor: this sounds like much less of a good deal to me.

Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG: definitely a good deal!

Softlanding Linux System: don't know much about Linux, but probably a good deal.

NASA's Space Launch System: I think it's taken way too much money to develop it to the point where it is now. But I also think that over time, it will eventually prove to be worth it.

The user below me has only once ever come remotely close to stepping on a porcupine.

I don't even think I've seen a porcupine outside of a zoo.

TUBM will watch the livestream I'm about to set up

True I clicked the button

The User Below Me Wants Windows 10

Kind of, though Ive heard some bad things about it. Not quite trusting of it yet.

TUBM will be as smart as littlebuddy0 here and also join my twitch stream.
